<Text>SO SO ! When we need stuff for around the house I usually hit Home Depot or Lowes because both have the same model...lots of stuff and no service ! Of course when you go to the smaller stores like Ace or even these guys you know you are gonna pay more but you expect to get some SERVICE ! On Monday I popped in here to pick up 3 items I needed..a small bag of hickory chunks, a bag of potting soil and a spray can of a rust converting product. I saw some bags of potting soil stacked against a wall out the front of the store so I grabbed one and carried it in with me. I walked in the front entrance around 2.45pm and there were a bunch of staff inside the checkout enclosure to my right...no one greeted me. I did hear one staff member yell out for everyone to hear....does anyone remember the password for the wi-fi ? I walked past and I was completely ignored. I walked around to the other side of the checkout counter and put the bag of potting down. I asked for someone to point me in the direction of the hickory chunks and the spray can of anti rust. Some guy who was talking to a supplier in there middle of an aisle pointed me in 2 different directions for the stuff I needed. I found the hickory chunks but the paint section was a little overwhelming and I had to ask the same guy again ( he sounded irritated when she led me to the little spot in the paint aisle where he handed me a can of Rust-Oleum Rust Reformer ) and then walked off. Not the friendliest service I have encountered lately. I walked over to the checkout counter and paid. The mature female cashier kindly walked around to the other side of the counter and retrieved a shopping cart for me. <date>1421509106692<//date><review>I've rented quite a few storage units over the years and currently have 2 units with budget. The initial contact and most of the customer service has been good on a courtesy level. However I have asked to get my payment pushed to the 15th. They told me that wasn't an option. I've never known anyone to not allow that. And I've never missed a payment. From day one I've asked for that. I also call every month to ask again. But instead I get a 25 dollar late fee. Really $25??? Then they try and charge another $10 to do it over the phone. I pay double rent every month. when I get back in town I am loading everything up and putting it elsewhere. The unit itself let's in the elements because if there isn't dust on something it's water spots. I'm getting rid of my couches which were initially new. And also there's gang writing spray painted in one of the units. Real classy!
If you're on the fence go down the road and find a different place. The extra couple bucks you think you're saving will be aquired through other means.
Update: Since I put up this review I got a letter stating my rent will now go up 9 dollars. I'm now over $35 month than originally quoted. Need I say more?< /review>< name>
Aaron Cole<//name>

<user>106133135402960938574< /user><name>Papanick Cunha</name>< Date>

<Rating>1< /Rating>< Review>
No Good will at Goodwill!

The old saying, "if I could leave 0 stars I would"  applies to this company.
I have 10 large bags of mostly ladies clothing in beautiful condition!  200 to 300 pounds worth!
I pull up to the drop boxes and let the lady employee know I had an SUV full of bags to give.
She said I had to park across the parking lot and carry them! Thats 45 yards away and the lightest bag is about 30lbs! I showed her my hands that are crippled with arthritis and Im wearing braces on both.
Her response was , " I don't care!. Everybody else does it!"
So me being a respond in kind type of person said,
" I guess I have to dump them off in a parking lot somewhere" Her response? Thats good too!
Wow!
So much for good will.üòï<//Review>

1524668755956</Date>
<rate>2< /rate>< text>
In terms of shopping, there are a few good finds here but mostly there are a lot of broken, stained items and overpriced items (if I can buy it new at Target for the same or less, then not going to buy it used with a stain here)
In terms of donating,  this location is atrocious. On more than one occasion I've shown up, even after calling, to be told they weren't taking any donations that day. The last time, I parked in front, walked right past the "Donate Here" sign and into the store only to be yelled at by one of the employees "No donations!" and shooed out. By no means do I expect a royal reception just for having a few items I no longer need, and I understand that occasionally there may not be enough staff to receive donations, but this has been a consistent problem and it doesn't seem unreasonable that they put up a sign to let folks know before they get everything out of their cars (or at least take down the sandwich board sign that says they are accepting donations). It seems they are doing a disservice<//text>

< text>
Tea house is an understatement. They have all kinds of awesome dessert items. They are also open later than most places. It is usually crowded, so coming a little later in the evening works great.
Parking nearby is very limited; there is free parking on the side roads but you have to be lucky to find one. Street parking is free in the evenings but all the spots are often taken.</text>

<UserId.>107293428008203030765<//UserId.><Rate>2<//Rate><Text>So this is my first time trying Sno crave. I was craving something sweet at night so decided to go. I live right down the street from them and thought this was a perfect place to go. I first went in to purchase a ice cream macaron sandwich strawberry cheesecake flavor to go ($6.51). I then went to McDonald's just to purchase a sandwich. While waiting for my McDonald purchase,  I was super excited to try my strawberry cheesecake macaron and couldn't wait till I got home. When I took a bite, it tasted awful and had a little bit a frostbite taste to it. kind of like old ice cream. I then went back to Sno crave and told them that I was very dissatisfied with the product and explained to them why and ask to get my money back. I then was told that I could not get my money back because once the product left the store there was no way it was possible. The only option that I was given was either to purchase something else, to get a free drink next time I come in, or 50% off of my next purchase. I asked to speak to the manager and was told that he was on vacation and if I wanted to speak with him that I would have to email him. I still was craving something sweet so decided to give the macaroon back and try they're toasted bread creme brulee with a scoop of ice cream, which by the way was absolutely exceptionally good, But I did not eat the ice cream. This is the only reason why I'm giving this a two-star rating otherwise it would only be a one-star rating. Now when he rang me up for the creme brulee toast he only took 10% off. Now remember I was under the impression that I would get 50% off of my next purchase. That did not happen. I paid approximately $6 for this as well. So now for creme brulee toast and a scoop of ice cream, I paid approximately $12. This is absolutely ridiculous. So I sat at the table for approximately 15 minutes before I received my order. Now here's where it gets worse during the 15 minutes I sat there and observed the employees. They all were wearing gloves, as they should, but I never saw one glove change. I saw one employee handle money, go inside of the bathroom twice, take out the garbage from the bathroom and put it into another bigger garbage can and then when my order was ready she decided to package it, handled the Saran Wrap and wrap my ice cream that was inside of a to go container with no lid, handle a plastic fork at some napkins and put them inside a to-go bag and not once changed her gloves. Luckily the creme brulee bread was already in a closed container before she handled it. I did not want to make any more of a scene, so by this time I was a little bit Fed Up and decided to leave and go home. Plus this was also was happening about 30 minutes before they close, and they still had a table of approximately six to eight people who had already received their order and will waiting to receive the check. I do hope that after the manager reads this, he will be a very honest person and hopefully get this resolved and give me a better compensation for the service that I received. Considering he does have cameras and can see that how I explain my experience is true.<//Text><Response>None</Response><user_name>rachelamaya77</user_name><pictures>None</pictures><Date>1502301850066< /Date>< Gmap_id>

<Text>I'm super glad Sno-Crave finally opened up a SF location! I can always satisfy my sweet tooth whenever I want now with plenty of boba choices and a toast box.

I came here during soft opening and the service here was quite attentive. The waitress kept coming back and asking if everything is ok.

I ordered my favorite boba, the lavender milk tea. The one thing they don't have here is the secret supersized version that other Sno-Crave locations have. Maybe they will add it in the future? (Although  I never finish it, it's exciting to have and I always order it) I also tried to fresh coconut with coconut jelly inside and I loved it. It's hard to find that elsewhere. Also had the macaron party toast box and I found the bread to be baked perfectly, even better than the other locations. Portions are huge, so it's perfect for sharing!

Parking isn't so easy around here though, so it's a hit or miss with the meters.<//Text>< pics>

<name>Zack Lawrence<//name><date>1465749590263< /date><Rate>2</Rate>< review>
I was not pleased with my recent trip to Ruby's as the service was terrible. My party was seated and we waited 15+ minutes to be helped. I ordered a strawberry lemonade and I received water with black strawberries inside. I ordered a BLTA which was good, although the bacon was undercooked and extremely fatty, the avocado was brown and half of the sandwich was lettuce. Another person in my party ordered a Turkey Breast Sandwich and fries. Unfortunately, there was several long, black hairs under them. Overall, staff was non-responsive and the food was not so good. I was expecting more from such a great chain of diners.<//review>

This is the worst store to buy furniture from!  We have purchased several thousand dollars worth of furniture in the past 5-7 years with issues on half of it.  No more! They sent someone to inspect and he turned in a report that said we didn‚Äôt have a box spring that was right next to the mattress.  They denied our claim.  We called to get him sent out again and he corrected his report.  In the mean time we had purchased a replacement mattress.  Long story short, we received a substantial credit that they won‚Äôt apply to the mattress we just bought.  So we went in and bought some more furniture.  Part of it was to be delivered today.  We never received the call to give us a window yesterday, I called this morning and they told me that they tried to deliver at 10:05, called the ‚Äúprimary number‚Äù on file (mine and they didn‚Äôt) and didn‚Äôt have a gate code.  Are your kidding me?!?!  They didn‚Äôt have a gate code cause they NEVER called me!  I will now have to wait on their time and calendar for my furniture.  We will NEVER buy from them again!!!</review>

<text>My comments are less about my experience at this store, (which would get 0 STARS) and more about an individual that literally saved me from cancelling my $2,800 purchase. Long story short, I bought a sectional in January, being told that it would be delivered the first week of April. Then it was May, then June. Then I went into the store and was told that "they were not sure if it would even be made".  After emails and VM's were not answered, I had enough. I called to cancel my purchase. I dealt with Cindy. Her energy, engagement and willingness to find out what in the world was going on was exactly what I was looking for the entire time. After she researched, she connected with her sales manager.  Then she managed to give me something no one else could, an answer! After her explanation, (and assurance that my sectional would be made and delivered in June) I decided to maintain my purchase and wait until June.

While I have been anything but happy with the lack of transparency, competency during this entire process, Cindy provided the best Service Recovery I have ever been given. She was delightful, and showed a sincere desire to get me a solution. I am extremely grateful. <pictures>None< /pictures>< review>
Terrible service! All of their couches are brought in from Asia and they are selling furniture that they don't have current stock of. I understand the challenges during the pandemic. But, don't promise me a delivery time around the beginning of Oct when I start shopping, at check out a delivery time at the end of october, then at the end of October tell me it will arrive in the new year. They are rude, don't care what you have to say, and can't wait to get you off the phone when you pose challenges.

I had to call them to get an update of when I will receive my furniture. I've also waited for over 2 months. Their credit system is a credit card, good luck being approved for enough balance to cover your purchase! I don't know any credit card companies who hand out a $5,000 limit to someone they don't know.

Misleading, rude, non-communicative, and overpriced! All made of plastic, too.< /review>

< review>
I loved the selection of furniture. The prices were very reasonable. Since we are moving and need a lot of furniture we were going to spend a lot of money and most of it was going to be at this store. Our salesman Steve was actually helpful and knowledgeable for a while but towards the end of our visit he seemed to have lost his patience and was downright rude to us. He even pointed out how long we were there and that if we didn't buy anything that he wouldn't make any money that day. He was even condescending and very off putting. In a nutshell: Nice furniture, good prices but this Steve guy is not an asset to this company. He is a liability. This is just my personal opinion based on that day's encounter.</review>

Today, 2.5 years later I tried to use one of those plans. I submitted a claim for 3 different areas of damage on my sofa. <review>I am still waiting for the scheduled delivery to arrive next week. My experience in the store was 5 star, if all goes well with the delivery, I will give that a five star as well!

Buying furniture can feel as "fun" as buying a car. Today was different.

As soon as I walked in the store Ebraham "Abe" welcomed me and immediately set out to make sure I saw all the options available and stayed within my budget without pressure or making me feel I was being cheap or would regret not spending more, something the other four stores I have shopped could not accomplish. Abe gave me good information that helped me make the proper decision, and then followed that information with great suggestions to keep my purchase in the best condition and under warranty.

I enjoyed my time with Abe, and after working with him I feel that he's the kind of person you want as a neighbor, he's very friendly and open.

I was the manager of a very popular very pink retail store that appeals to young girls and women and who's mascot and main attraction is a cute Japanese kitten. In *my* store it was extremely important that each customer was greeted *genuinely*, presented with options *within their budget*, and leave *feeling happy* with their purchase and a *desire to come back again*. I would have been very pleased to have Abe as an employee. He is a skilled salesperson who doesn't push, isn't anxious about making a sale, seems genuine in his desire to get the customer something they want and can afford; he is an asset to this store.

I'm wanting to purchase recliners, mattresses, and a small console table in the near future. Abe had his measuring tape at the ready and found me more then a few options for all of the things I was looking for. I purchased a mattress ahead of my schedule, and I plan on returning to purchase other items in a few months.

I would definitely recommend Jerome's, mainly because of my experience with Ebraham, and to be honest, the prices and quality I saw were pretty dang good also.<//review><pics>None< /pics><response>{'time': 1569010180604, 'text': 'Hello Pc Brown,\nThank you for taking the time to post your review and provide feedback regarding your experience. Unfortunately I had to change my delivery date to the next day and they were so hassle free when I called them. I am so pleasantly satisfied with their product and service I will be using them for all my furniture needs. A+ on customer satisfaction!</text>

< review>
Sales staff was pleasant and professional, reasonably knowledgeable and eager to help. Selection was OK. Different styles come in only a single color and fabric choice, for example. In our case we found just what we were looking for though.

We did our shopping online but went into the store to make a final decision. I am glad we had that option. As soon as we sat in our 2nd choice it was an immediate No. Our 1st selection was definitely what we were looking for. If we had not been able to sit in both we would have never known.

Delivery was prompt and notification included a live tracker showing the driver's progress to our house. Clever.

The delivery men were quick, but thorough and neat. They allowed my wife the time to vacuum the floor after removing the old couch and before installing the new.

Quality of the couch delivered seems to be identical to what we saw in the showroom.</review>

< Text>
We visits Jerome's in Corona about a month ago where the staff was so friendly and helpful.

Yesterday day we visited th Moreno Valley Jerome's to revisit some of the furniture we were interested in. The only reason we visit the Moreno Valley store is because it's only 8 miles from our house.
We were in the store approximately 30 minutes with no sale's rep greeting us.At this time we locate a sale rep for assistance. This sale rep turned out to be the store manager. We asked  him several direct questions about the products. He seem to not want to answer the questions directly . He go off on up selling the product.  We asked him about another product on the opposite side of the store, at this time his attitude changed and became  very pushy and arrogant. We thought this was odd and just thank him for his time and left the store.

Because of the experience at the Corona Jerome's store we gave them a second chance. That day we drove to the Corona Store and within a minutes  of entering the store we were greeted with a big smile from a sales representative named Anna. Anna ask if she could be of assistance. We spent 2 hours in the store asking several questions of Anna . Anna,Superviser and staff went above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable with the products that were purchased.. We came to respect Anna's work ethic, politeness, professionalism and most of all. The patients with all our questions.
We will definitely be back to only the Corona store for our future furniture purchases.

< Text>
Buyers keep this in mind:  Once you sign to receive the furniture, it is FINAL, you are out of luck even if it is not comfortable, they do not warranty "Satisfaction". So, do your research and comparing with other vendors, make absolutely sure you will be happy with your selection.

In my case, it make my backache worse, this is something I couldn't find out by trying it for 5 minutes at the store. I bought an Electric Reclining Love-seat, after two days of using it, I found out the quality of comfort is lacking. The foot pedal does not rise up high enough, the front of the seat bottom does not tilt up allowing your thigh to support part of your body weight, it is rested solely on my buttock and the padding is too stiff, creating pressure points, thus making my backache worse.  I negotiated back and forth with Customer Service for two days, they sent a technician out to verify then determined there is no "Manufacturing Defect" and my complaint is not covered under warranty.

Hope my experience would help your purchase a pleasant one.</Text>

Sean Shih< /Name>

I would highly recommend asking for Jeremy or Troy when shopping and Jerome‚Äòs furniture in Corona California!!  They definitely have my business!!.< /review>

I like shopping at Jerome‚Äôs. This is not my first purchase there. I purchased a sectional this time. My visit to the store went great. The sales reps are very knowledgeable and helpful and go out of their way to make sure I am satisfied.

The problem I had with this particular purchase was in the delivery. Alex and his partner did a great job in doing the installation and even moved my old furniture out into the garage. I had to call in to the service department. They said the soonest they could deliver the correct piece would be tomorrow. I was not satisfied with that response. I asked to have it brought out today, of which they finally agreed to do.

I would‚Äôve liked all that to have gone smoother. Naturally it would‚Äôve been best if the pieces were marked correctly but I guess that‚Äôs not Jerome‚Äòs fault. <response>{'time': 1450751422666, 'text': "Hello Stacey, I am Zach with Jerome's, I cannot locate the order but would be happy to look into options on this if you could provide me with order information. I am sorry for the inconvenience and lack of response in this issue. I look forward to hearing from you, and hope you have a great week and holiday season.\nZachary, Social Customer Service Rep\nJerome's Furniture, San Marcos, CA\n866-633-4094, ext 5051 or 6220\nIn Office 11am-730p, Out of Office Wednesday and Thursday"}<//response><Pics>None</Pics><name>Stacey Mitchell</name>< Text>
Since I can't give a "0" a one will have to do. We purchased a "leather" sofa and love seat with power controls. We had a very old lazy boy that was still in decent shape, but due to my disability I was unable to use the manual controls.
In less than a week the "spray sealer" they use on the "leather" started peeling. We were told it was natural leather (not bonded) and it would breath. Not True!
Shortly after that it got a small hole in between the cushions. (Since we purchased the warranty that is supposed to cover every thing under the sun except Sharpies, shouldn't have been a problem???)
The deep brown color also started fading to an orange color is several spots.
Jerome's and the warranty company were useless. As instructed I reported the damage immediately. I filled out and mailed back (you cannot send by e-mail) the forms requested. I never heard back.
Additional discoloration and cracking on the vinyl parts started to happen, again I reported it and filled out the forms they e-mailed with no response.
I called and was told perhaps you should go to the post office and mail the forms as certified. I had already explained I was disabled and could not drive to the post office. I was told that's a shame. We don't accept e-mails of the forms we e-mailed you.
They claim to have never received any information about problems with the couch when my husband contacted them, so since it wasn't reported immediately it is not covered. YES I HAVE THE E-MAILS.
I purchased a cheap touch up kit for the color and while I was covering the large orange spots, I found part of the "leather" was peeling. The part peeling off was about as thick as a piece of tissue. (Not Kleenex, the kind you wrap things in.)
I used some vinyl adhesive to keep the spot from getting worse and have not reported it, because life is stressful enough without dealing with a company that hires people who lie and seem to have no problem with unsatisfied customers.
The salesman actually told us that bad reviews were a problem so they were implementing better customer service to keep customers happy....well he also said the couch was leather and the cushions would last, you wouldn't feel metal bars through them in less than a year...another lie.
I have spoken to Jerome's and the warranty company and was basically told if I wasn't disabled they may help. Since I am and cannot come in to speak to them in person...suck's for me. They did not guarantee help if I came in, and I feel they would have just tried to sell me something else had I been able to get there.
I hope the salesman making his sales quota was worth making my life so miserable, too bad I won't know when Karma catches up to him and the rest of the staff that basically have their hands tied due to the policies Jerome's and the warranty company have in place.
I hope the spray and stain that have worn off the couch (not made in the USA) is not extremely toxic to my family.</Text>

< text>
I purchased a bed & the salesperson was very nice (I purchased it in Corona) I paid cash & it was delivered & set up in a timely manner. My headboard however was damaged on a front panel & was missing paint in several spots. I called customer service & agreed to have a new headboard sent out. When it arrived we noticed that it was more damaged than the first headboard so it was returned & I called again. This time they sent a technician out to try to repair it. He ended up making the headboard look worse that the original damage so I called again. This time I asked to go down to corporate headquarters and pick out a headboard myself to have replaced. We set up an appt. so that they could have a few headboards pulled out and ready for me to choose. I rearranged my day & drove down to San Diego. They had no appt. for me set up & I had to wait for them to find a headboard. They pulled one down & minus a few paint issues it looked decent. They had it tagged with blue tape on all the areas that needed paint adjustment including one of the front panels where it was clumpy. I told the lady that was helping me that if they could not fix the front panel without making it worse to not touch it. When the delivery truck arrived to replace the original headboard with this new one I noticed that there were severe scratches & scrapes on the headboard in 3 different areas. There was also a crack that was chipped on the end on one of the panels. There were no signs of repair for the paint on the headboard I picked out. In fact, there were no signs of repair of the clumping paint on the one panel. Any way you look at it it has not been touched. This was not the same headboard. Even the delivery men said that the box had its original tape & staples sealed by the manufacturer; it had not been opened and resealed. They too agreed that this was not the same headboard. Since they had already attached the new headboard & were loading up the old one, we kept the new headboard in place while I find out where mine is so I called again. That day customer service hung up on me twice & finally a 3rd time I talked to a man who was upset that I had not declined headboard & made it sound like I was to be stuck with this new headboard. At this point I was done with this company & I asked for them to either find my headboard or take back the bed & refund me my money. He told me that they can only do that with the original sales woman I purchased the bed from so they connected me to the Corona location. I ended up talking to another woman in customer service. She tried to find my headboard. At first she told me that they did not hold it and ended up losing it and then another time she called me back and tried to tell me that it was in fact the same headboard. When I asked again for a full refund she said that she will try to figure something out & will call me back. 3 days later I still had not received a call so I called again. I ended up talking to another woman who went searching for my headboard & came up with the original information that it was not tagged but indeed lost within the warehouse. She set up an appt. to have a manager go through the headboards & find one in good condition & had it marked for delivery to me. We set up a delivery day for yesterday. I received a phone call & a text a message saying my delivery time was between 10 a.m. and 2 p.m. for yesterday. At 2:30 I went online to see my order status & find out when they were going to be. I planned my day around their delivery time & I agreed to cover someone at work that evening. The order status said my delivery time was between 415 and 8:15 p.m. Nobody bothered to call me so I called customer service. We rescheduled a time for today & when I did not get the confirmation I called this morning. They decided to deliver yesterday evening anyway, did not have an appointment set up for today, & now I am without a new headboard & waiting for a call back from customer service because this new headboard is now lost. I am at the point where I want a full refund. This company is a joke!< /text>

< review>
I don't like shopping, let alone furniture shopping, but it is something that has to be done from time to time.  My wife and I went to Jerome's Furniture looking for a new sofa and I was dreading pushy sales people following us around like, well like used car salesmen.

That had been our experience at another furniture store.

When we walked into Jerome's we were greeted in a friendly manner by a sales person and asked if they could be of help.  Even tho I was probably a bit gruff, I said "no thank you, we're just looking" and to my surprise, they did not follow us around but just let us shop. When we had some questions it was easy to find a sales person who answered our questions without being pushy.

To bottom line it, I will certainly go back to Jerome's for any future furniture shopping trips whenever my wife makes me go along.<//review>

<user>100318318930768569269<//user>< Name>
Kristy Axelrod<//Name>
< Time>
1421358386208<//Time>
< Rating>
1< /Rating>
< text>
I spent months looking for the perfect sofa for my space. I needed specific things and Jerome's had what I thought was my dream sofa. For those who want to look up what I got I purchased the Cassius sectional. Anyways, I was told the protection plan would cover pet damage but the scratches from my cats on my sofa isn't covered so I wasted $130 for coverage that does NOTHING for me! The ottoman's pistons have stopped working so it's a pain to access the storage. The back pillows on the edges have a wood frame and they dig into your back (This is a design flaw and cannot be fixed properly) There's a very uncomfortable bar across the chaise so you can't lay down on it without feeling it. If you sit on the chaise it feels like you are in a sunken hole! On top of that, the bonded leather is already staring to peel!! Peeling isn't covered by ANY warranty at all with this company or the protection plan! I'm out $1500! I was told that the damaged/faulty parts could be replace but they are design flaws and nothing can really be done. I get to have parts replaced and in less than 8 months, have the SAME problem AGAIN! Next time I will be out of my 1 year warranty with a protection plan that does me no good!!!! This is unacceptable!!!!! My $400 Ikea sofa which was bonded leather also held up WAY better than this crap they sold me!

I will NEVER recommend Jerome's to ANYONE. I regret ever stepping into their stores!  I'm waiting now for when my Jerome's mattress starts falling apart. It's newer than the sofa!

I have spoke with several other people regarding this issue also I was told when I made the appointment for the warranty tech to come out I would get refunded since there was so many issues with my sofa. Of course I know that was just another lie like the pet damage in the protection plan. I posted on their Facebook page about the issues and not once did a post go through to their wall! I did get a call from Mr. Ozzy who I see replies here on yelp. However after getting his message and calling back for 2 weeks, I never got a response.

I'm totally disgusted by their product I was sold as well as the customer service!<//text>
< Pictures>
None< /Pictures>

This warranty covers any manufacturing defects which are reported within the first year from the original delivery date.  Your one year warranty is valid until April 6, 2015.\n\nThe second warranty through Guardsman, which you opted to purchase, covers an array of one-time accidental stains and damages.  Unfortunately, pet damages are not covered under this warranty.\n\nJerome's is unable to offer any cancellations or refunds of the Guardsman Protection Plan.  All cancellation requests must be requested directly through Guardsman.  Their office can be contacted at (800) 253-3957.\n\nAfter review of your account, I confirmed a technician inspected the 2 piece sleeper yesterday, January 14, 2015.\n\nWe have confirmed that the seat cushion cores do need to be replaced, which will alleviate the issue of the wooden frame which you listed above.  We are unable to offer or provide any alternative options due to the pet damage which is currently on the sleeper.\n\nI do understand your frustration; however, we can gladly order the seat cushion cores according to our warranty.\n\nI will have our service department follow-up with your tomorrow in regards to your service.\n\nShould you have any additional questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to contact us directly.\n\nSincerely,\n\nJerome's Furniture"}</response>
